subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 08 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Ball admits FA misconduct charge
Man City defender Michael Ball is set to serve a three-match ban after admitting he stamped on Man Utd's Cristiano Ronaldo.



 
FA charges Brown after headbutt
Fulham midfielder Michael Brown is charged with violent conduct after headbutting Liverpool's Xabi Alonso.



 
Group eyes £50m Charlton takeover
A foreign consortium is putting together a bid for newly relegated Charlton Athletic, BBC Sport understands.








GOLF




Rush expected for Walker tickets
A rush for Walker Cup tickets is anticipated after a crowd limit of 10,000 was placed on the event at Royal County Down.



 
Woods battles to Wachovia victory
Tiger Woods shoots a final-round 69 to clinch the Wachovia Championship in Charlotte by two strokes.



 
Fernandez-Castano wins play-off
Spain's Gonzalo Fernandez-Castano beats Austrian Markus Brier in a play-off to win the Italian Open.








MOTORSPORT




Renault expect tough Spanish test
Formula One champions Renault still expect to be trailing Ferrari and McLaren at this week's Spanish Grand Prix.



 
Stoner powers to Shanghai victory
Ducati's Casey Stoner saw off the challenge of Valentino Rossi to win the China Grand Prix and extend his MotoGP series lead to 15 points.



 
Loeb wraps up Argentina victory
World champion Sebastien Loeb wins the Rally of Argentina.








FORMULA ONE




Renault expect tough Spanish test
Formula One champions Renault still expect to be trailing Ferrari and McLaren at this week's Spanish Grand Prix.



 
Alonso backs Spanish GP changes
World champion Fernando Alonso says changes to Spain's Grand Prix track will make overtaking easier.



 
Second crash at Spanish GP track
Williams' Nico Rosberg is unhurt in the second high-speed crash at the Circuit de Catalunya this week.








ATHLETICS




Glasgow begins Commonwealth bid
Glasgow's official 2014 bid document  is on its way to London to be handed over to the Games Federation.



 
Mutai takes Belfast marathon win
Kenyan John Mutai comes close to a record time in claiming victory in the 26th Deep RiverRock Belfast City Marathon on Monday.



 
Kenyan triumphs in Edinburgh run
Hosea Macharinyang wins the men's Great Edinburgh Run, with Jelena Prokopcuka securing the women's title.








CYCLING




Giro champion Basso denies doping
Italy's Ivan Basso denies doping, the day after admitting he was involved in the Operation Puerto blood doping scandal.



 
GB is top cycling nation - King
British Cycling boss Peter King says this country's riders are the best in the world and will be GB's best hopes of Olympic gold.



 
Under-fire Basso parts with team
Ivan Basso quits the Discovery Channel team after an investigation into his role in a Spanish doping scandal is reopened.
